issue.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people
issue.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Abortion is a highly controversial issue.
We should raise the issue of discrimination with the council.
The key issue is whether workers should be classified as ‘employees’.
issue.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a magazine or newspaper printed for a particular day, week, or month
issue.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Have you seen the latest issue?
The article appeared in the January issue of ‘Nature’.
issue.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the act of officially giving people something to use
issue.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: the issue of identity cards to all non-residents
issue.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a new set of something such as shares or stamps, made available for people to buy
issue.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: We launched the share issue on March 1.
issue.translation[0].note_box[0].section: discuss/debate an issue
They met to discuss the issue of working conditions at the factory.
raise an issue/bring up an issue
Some important issues were raised at the meeting.
deal with/tackle an issue
The government must deal with the issue of gun crime.
The company said that it will address the issue at the next scheduled board meeting.
decide/settle/resolve an issue
The issue was settled after some tough negotiations.
No deadline has been set to resolve the issue.
face an issue
Politicians seem to be reluctant to face the issue.
avoid/evade an issue
There is no point in evading the issue any longer.
confuse/cloud/muddy the issue
You must not let your feelings cloud the issue.
highlight an issue
The minister used his speech to highlight the issue of global warming.
an issue comes up
The issue arose during a meeting of the Budget Committee.
the issues surrounding something
This chapter discusses the ethical issues surrounding genetically modified foods.
a political/social/economic etc issue
They discussed a number of political issues.
an important issue
The committee met several times to discuss this important issue.
a key/major/big issue
For me, the big issue is cost.
a difficult/complex issue
He was able to grasp complex issues quickly.
a controversial/sensitive issue
Abortion is a controversial issue.
a thorny issue
Illegal immigration is always a thorny issue.
a burning issue
For country-dwellers, transport is a burning issue.
wider issues
This is a question that raises much wider issues.
a topical issue
The magazine discusses topical issues in science.
the underlying issue
This research explores some of the underlying issues related to high unemployment.
a fundamental issue
Decisions still need to be made about some fundamental issues.
an unresolved issue
A number of unresolved issues remain before the treaty can be signed.
a range of issues
A range of issues were debated at the meeting.
something is not the issue
Price alone is not the issue.
issue.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
issue.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
a warning issued by the Surgeon General
issue.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if an organization or someone in an official position issues something such as documents or equipment, they give these things to people who need them
issue.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The US State Department issues millions of passports each year.
All the workers were issued with protective clothing.
The policy document will be issued to all employees.
issue.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to officially produce something such as new stamps, coins, or shares and make them available to buy
issue.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to officially give something such as a document to someone who needs or wants it
issue.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Northwest Airlines issued fliers with discount coupons.
Visa USA licenses US financial institutions to issue Visa cards.
issue.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: if an organization issues SECURITIES such as bonds and shares, it makes them available for people to buy
issue.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The company recently issued bonds with yields under 10%.
The company had been given permission to issue up to 35 million new shares to more than 100,000 employees in 29 countries.
issue.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: if a bank issues coins or BANKNOTEs, it makes them available and puts them into CIRCULATION
issue.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: The Bank of England issues notes and acts a banker to the government.
issue.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the act of making SECURITIES such as bonds, shares etc available for sale, and the securities themselves
issue.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The shareholders are expected to approve two issues of common stock.
Please confirm total number of shares in issue (=existing) at the end of the period in order for us to update our records.
issue.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: an occasion when a bank or government makes new paper money or coins available to be used
issue.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Before Christmas the issue of banknotes is increased to meet the extra demand.
